result.execSummary:
The defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. To be paid through collection  by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription. No association with known drug users or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Pay all supervision fees, to make regular payments.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample to Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adan Perez-Cisneros

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.  /dds
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Swanson, Br. 11, calendar successor, for review. mag
Original transcript (34 pages) commencing SENTENCE HEARING 11/04/2014. Received and Filed.

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense, and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 5 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  
-Maintain Full Time Employment
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Received and filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant is remanded.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 11/4/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in court with attorney Matthew T Luening.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/4/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in court with attorney Matthew T Luening.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 7/1/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in court with attorney Matthew T Luening.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew
Court allows attorney Luening to substitute in as attorney of record.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/30/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter:  Alexander Wirth
Defense counsel wants to retain Matthew Leuning.  Case adjourned for status on 5/13/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in court with attorney Adam Galaviz for attorney Reyna I Morales.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 3. Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription, and no possession of any firearms. Court ordered Defendant to continue to follow all conditions of bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in court with attorney Adam Galaviz for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Brenda Bartholomew.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State has informed the Court that defendant has been released from Federal Custody.  This letter is being sent to inform all parties of the next scheduled court date.
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-08-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.
Court informs parties that it has been verified that defendant is in federal custody.
Court will withdraw stayed bench warrant and orders case adjourned for CAUSE and adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros not in court.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel appeared in court, but not present in court when case called on the record.  Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. Deputy M. Metz informs the Court that the defendant may have been turned over to immigration.
Court will order a stayed bench warrant and orders case passed.
Clerk:  jms

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Adan Perez-Cisneros in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
